page.title: 01DAVIOT,STRATHNAIRN,INVERNESS
page.content: Daviot is a scattered rural area, six miles south of the highland capital, Inverness,bordering Culloden Moor. The main road, the A9, runs through the village, separating the village into to separate areas, Daviot East and West. The A9 runs north from Perth, right to Inverness and then on up to Wick, in the far North. The Strath is two hundred metres above sea level and is mostly hilly moorland with a lot of{heather},fir trees!_and hill sheep farms. Two landmarks, which can be seen when coming in to Daviot are the {church}and the{quarry.}Because of the quarry there is a lot of traffic, especially lorries, going up and down the A9. On the whole, Daviot is a pleasant, peaceful place but unfortunately, the A9 encourages people to rush through!
